page.title: 07TRANSPORT IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The sad decline of public transport is sorely felt by many of the elderly residents in the village. Although most families own a car. it is the older citizens who miss the regular bus service into either Rhyl or Holywell. There are now only 6 buses from the village a day, all going to Rhyl. The busis considered important for people requiring transport to visit the Doctor or Hospital, or else to the Supermarket. The village has now only one shop. and this obviously cannot cover all the requirements of the villagers. The return fare to Rhyl, 8 miles away, is 91p single for an adult. Only a few of the residents possess and use either a bicycle or a motor cycle. A bus goes to the Point of Ayr Colliery but now carris only a few miners.
